content.user_title: Build P2P networking for decentralized apps
content.value_statement: Implementing peer-to-peer networking for decentralized platforms requires understanding encrypted communication, gossip protocols, and distributed state management. This skill provides ready-to-use patterns using commonware for authenticated, encrypted P2P connections.
actual_capabilities: Implement authenticated peer connections using Ed25519 keypairs
Design message protocols for repository sync and announcements
Build gossip protocols for decentralized message propagation
Configure network topology with bootstrap nodes and peer discovery
Implement peer state management and connection lifecycle
Apply security patterns including encryption and rate limiting
limitations: Does not provide pre-built binaries or deployment scripts
Does not include consensus algorithm implementation
Does not integrate with specific cloud providers
Does not handle storage layer implementation

faq.question: Which platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Works with any AI assistant that can understand Rust patterns.

faq.question: What transport protocols are supported?
faq.answer: Uses QUIC and TCP transports with Noise XX protocol for encrypted handshakes and Ed25519 authentication.

faq.question: How does peer discovery work?
faq.answer: Uses DHT for distributed peer discovery plus bootstrap nodes for initial network entry and peer announcements.

faq.question: Is my data safe with P2P networking?
faq.answer: All traffic is encrypted with Noise protocol. Peers are authenticated via Ed25519 signatures. Rate limiting and peer scoring prevent abuse.

faq.question: Why are messages not reaching all peers?
faq.answer: Check that bootstrap nodes are accessible and peer scoring is not disconnecting nodes. Ensure message validation passes on receiving peers.

faq.question: How is this different from libp2p?
faq.answer: Commonware provides lighter-weight primitives optimized for performance. Uses QUIC by default and integrates with Simplex BFT consensus.
